title: The rise and fall of Neil Woodford: what happened to the man who couldn't stop making money?
text:
Britain's best-known fund manager Neil Woodford made a bold pledge to this newspaper five years ago. He vowed to make those who follow him even richer in the decades ahead.

"My best years as a fund manager are still in front of me," he said in the spring of 2014. "I’ll be here for decades to come."

Although a year later he was dubbed 'the man who can't stop making money', his forecast wasn't to be. On Tuesday the 59-year-old's frozen flagship income fund was wound down, leaving the legacy of one of Britain’s most famous money managers in tatters.
